Node.definition: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= the outcome of a dispute between two or more parties, decided by a judge or a deity
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
literally: smoothness; hence: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right

= action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well being, condition, and/or integrity
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= action by which humans or deities examine the character of humans by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= action by which deities or humans put together a plan or strategy to act on; often in a bad sense
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure
= pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

literally: footstep, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to bend (one's) ear; hence: = action by which humans or deities make a conscious effort to listen to what (other) humans say
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= center part of iris of eye, ≈ associated with care as this is a very sensitive part of the body that people are inclined to take proper care of
= a part of a larger object, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that object

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness
= causative action by which humans close the entrance(s) to a location, supposedly by shutting its doors (דֶּלֶת)
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified

literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
literally: to go around; hence: = action by which groups of humans or animals take position all around an individual, a group, or an object

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: to set (one's) eyes (to do something); hence: = action by which humans exercise their minds to determine what they will do
literally: to bend to the ground; exact meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to suffer humiliation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which objects are, or are perceived as having something in common with other objects

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect

Node.gloss: to desire|to long for|to be eager
Node.definition: = state/process by which humans, deities, or animals experience a strong desire to see an object or perform an event

Node.gloss: to tear to pieces|to maul|to mangle
Node.definition: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time
= a place where humans or animals go in order to not be readily seen by others, ► either to keep safe from danger or to attack others
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to approach|to come before|to stand before|to confront
Node.definition: = action by which humans place themselves in front of individuals or groups, facing either forward or backward, ► and either with good or with evil intentions; ≈ sometimes used figuratively in situations where humans come before God in worship, or where God confronts enemies, or when certain conditions are personified
literally: to cause to go down on (their) knees; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause their enemies to be struck down in battle, collapse and die

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
= human beings, regardless of sex and age
= human beings, regardless of sex and age
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans
= something that happens to someone; ◄ whether or not as recompense for what he/she has done

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

Node.gloss: to have (one's) fill > to be contented
Node.definition: literally: to be satiated; hence: = process by which the desire of humans is fulfilled
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: what remains, or is left over; hence: = possessions that one has in surplus over the possession one needs in order to live
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well

Node.gloss: to be satisfied (with something)|to have one's fill (of something)
Node.definition: literally: to be satiated (with an event); hence: = process by which humans become more than fully engaged in a certain process or activity, which can be either good or bad
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died
